description: Midway through the third quarter, the Nets trailed the Indianapolis Pacers by 25 points, and so the battle began simply to make the score respectable.

title: INSIDE
description: Order to Nuns at Auschwitz

title: NEW TAX ON GOODS IS WEIGHED TO PAY FOR HEALTH CARE
description: The White House said today that it was considering a value-added tax -- an indirect form of sales tax -- to help pay for President Clinton's health-care package. But it insisted that the President had not made any final decision on such a sweeping new proposal to raise revenue.

title: Nynex Unit Will Offer Speed Lines
description: The New York Telephone Company is starting an effort to win back business lost to upstart companies that sell sophisticated telecommunications services to corporate clients.

title: Khmer Rouge Quit Phnom Penh, Troubling U.N.
description: The commander of the United Nations peacekeeping force in Cambodia has expressed disquiet at the sudden departure of top Khmer Rouge officials from Phnom Penh, the capital, but says he still expects that more than 80 percent of registered voters will be able to take part normally in elections planned for next month.

title: Boys and the Street: Tempting Jerina, 18
description: Jerina Gervais heard that her old boyfriend was out of jail, and the news made her nervous.

title: Maxine Wood Dead; Playwright Was 87
description: Maxine Flora Finsterwald, a playwright and short-story writer who used the pen name Maxine Wood, died on April 7 at Summit Hospital in Oakland, Calif. She was 87 years old.

title:
FIELD TEST;
Sliding Your Way Toward Being Fit
description: HOME exercise equipment is not for the unmotivated. It takes a lot of get-up-and-go to hit the treadmill when it's right next to the easy chair. One workout system that won't mean a $3,000 investment is Slide Reebok by Kneedspeed, which will be in sporting-goods stores in June.

title: Dannenwalde Journal; A Portrait of the Informer (as People's Champion)
description: In a land where questions of guilt and collaboration hang in the air like dark clouds, few figures personify moral ambiguity as fully as Manfred Stolpe.

title: Review/Dance; The Question: What Is Reality? The Answer: Who Knows?
description: The ever-fertile mind of the Canadian choreographer Robert Desrosiers never ceases to come up with startling images to bombard the viewer. One in particular seems crucial to the theme of his wildly hallucinatory if wildly uneven new work, "Black and White in Color."

title: Former Policeman Sentenced in Slaying
description: A former New York City police officer was sentenced yesterday to 33 1/3 years to life in prison for shooting a liquor-store owner to death in a Brooklyn holdup and ordering another robber to shoot a store employee who was left paralyzed.

title: Egypt's Trampling of Rights Fosters Extremism; Some Other Cairo
description: To the Editor:

title: Beleaguered Andreotti Faces Senate Panel in Italy
description: Giulio Andreotti, Italy's elder statesman and emblem of its Machiavellian postwar politics, testified today before a committee of fellow senators supposed to decide whether to end his parliamentary immunity from prosecution on the explosive charge of conspiring with the Mafia.

title: U.S.B.L. Drafts Swoopes
description: Sheryl Swoopes, who led Texas Tech to the N.C.A.A. women's basketball title and was named player of the year, yesterday became the second woman drafted by the United States Basketball League.

title: ISRAEL MAY ACCEPT PALESTINIAN'S ROLE
description: Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin of Israel, after a meeting with President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt, said today that if Palestinians agreed to resume the peace talks he would lift his Government's ban on negotiating with Palestinian representatives from East Jerusalem.

title: 'AIDS Knockin' at Your Door'
description: The following text was taken from more than 20 hours of discussions with teen-agers from the New York City region. Excerpts appear with each article. Q Are there any norms about what kind of sexual activity is proper? DOUG KILCOMMONS , 17, Staten Island (Tottenville High School): Since I'm Christian, what I've been told by my parents is that sex before marriage is wrong, and I am going to wait to have sex until after I'm married.

title: AMOCO CHEMICAL COMPLETES SALE OF ITS WELCHEM UNIT
description: The Amoco Chemical Company said yesterday that it had completed the sale of Welchem Inc., a maker of chemicals for the petroleum industry, to the Petrolite Corporation for an undisclosed price. Petrolite is a St. Louis-based maker of specialty chemicals and services. The sale is the latest in a series by Amoco Chemical, a unit of the Amoco Corporation, which is based in Chicago.

title: In Move to Secure Aid, Yeltsin Plans Tokyo Visit
description: In a surprise move by Russia that could eventually pave the way for Japan to offer it considerably more aid, President Boris N. Yeltsin has asked to come to Tokyo next month after abruptly canceling such a trip last year, the Russian Foreign Minister told Japanese officials today.

title: Upstairs, Downstairs: A Way to Manage Both
description: WHEN Mark O'Connell decided to change careers, he never thought he would have to learn how to balance glasses on his head or to pack trousers without wrinkling them.

title: My 'Middle-Class' Family Lives From Paycheck to Paycheck
description: To the Editor:

title: Teledyne Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a gain of $ 24.2 million, or 44 cents a share, on sale of Litton Industries stock, a charge of $ 3.7 million on redemption of debt, and after a charge of $ 185.6 million from change in accounting for employees' post-retirement benefits.c-Included a charge of $ 2.7 million on the redemption of debt, and after a charge of $ 10 million from change in accounting for income taxes. Year-ago first quarter results were restated for this charge.Teledyne said its net income included a $ 6.2 million net charge related to the federal government's investigation of Teledyne Electronics. The charge for Teledyne Electronics was included in results of the company's aviation and electronics segment, which had sales of $ 282.9 million and pretax operating profit of $ 13.4 million for the quarter.

title: Larry Berthelson, 60, A Master of Puppetry
description: Larry Berthelson, the creator of the Pickwick Puppet Theater and a former president of the Puppetry Guild of Greater New York, died at his home in Santa Barbara, Calif., on April 8. He was 60.

title: POPE ORDERS NUNS OUT OF AUSCHWITZ
description: In a last-minute letter apparently intended to defuse the controversy on the 50th anniversary of the Warsaw ghetto uprising, Pope John Paul II told Roman Catholic nuns today to move from their convent at the Auschwitz death camp.

title: Illinois Central Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After a charge from adoption of FASB No. 106 of $ 100,000.c-Included a gain from adoption of FASB No. 109 of $ 23,400,000, or 55 cents a share.

title: RPM Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: Year-ago periods' share earnings were restated to reflect 50 percent stock dividend issued to shareholders on Dec. 4, 1992.

title: Bruce Lee's Brief Life Being Brought to Screen
description: Bruce Lee was a master of the martial arts, a man in pursuit of mental and physical perfection, a legend among young men. His mysterious death in 1973 at the age of 32 has made him an icon in the same pop cultural tradition as Jim Morrison, Janis Joplin, James Dean and Marilyn Monroe.

title: American Home Products reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a net gain of $ 310,004,000, or 98 cents a share, which included a gain of $ 383.3 million from adoption of FASB 109, a new method of accounting for income taxes, and a charge of $ 73.2 million from the adoption of FASB 106, a new method of accounting for employees' postretirement benefits.Year-ago income from continuing operations of $ 143,264,000, or 45 cents a share, included $ 220 million pretax charge related to the portion of the purchase price of Genetics Institute Inc. that represents acquired research.

title: Hopes and Tensions Rise in Haiti As Aristide's Return Seems Closer
description: Amid expectations of a diplomatic breakthrough, tensions grew here today as United Nations mediators prepared to meet with the country's military high command to seal the framework for a settlement of Haiti's 18-month political crisis.

title: Sex Survey of American Men Finds 1% Are Gay
description: A new national study on male sexual behavior, the most thorough published since the Kinsey report more than four decades ago, shows that about 2 percent of the men surveyed had engaged in homosexual sex and that 1 percent considered themselves exclusively homosexual.

title: Reliance Electric reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Year-ago first quarter's share earnings included an accounting charge of 1 cent a share due to the retroactive adoption of accounting standard 109.

title: The Reservoirs Runneth Over
description: New York City's reservoirs have gone from less full than normal to more than full. At 8 A.M. yesterday they were at 101.5 percent of capacity.

title: Dinkins Says Albany's Budget Threatens His
description: Saying that New York City had come up short in the state budget agreement reached last week in Albany, Mayor David N. Dinkins yesterday raised the possibility that the city might have to cut services to balance its own budget for the fiscal year that begins July 1.

title: Corrections
description: An article yesterday about the Federal trial involving the Bank of Commerce and Credit International misidentified the law firm of a witness, Cantwell F. Muckenfuss 3d, former deputy Comptroller of the Currency. It is Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher.

title: The Taxman Experiments
description: Eligible taxpayers in Ohio can meet tonight's filing deadline by punching in the required information on a touch-tone telephone. It's an experiment by the Internal Revenue Service to streamline income tax collection, like the electronic filing system originally tested in 1986 and now handling some 14 million returns a year.

title: Withstanding Shocks, Dow Rises
description: The stock market continued its bumpy march yesterday toward a Dow Jones industrial average of 3,500, now tantalizingly close. Cheered by falling interest rates, the market held on to most of the gains of Tuesday, amid some nasty surprises.

title: Stock Cars Headed to Indy
description: The Indianapolis Motor Speedway and Nascar yesterday announced as expected that a Winston Cup stock car race -- called the Brickyard 400 -- will be held at the historic oval on Aug. 6, 1994.

title: State Street Boston's Stock Tumbles 18%
description: Shares of the State Street Boston Corporation, one of the nation's most profitable banking companies in recent years, fell nearly 18 percent yesterday as investors and analysts reacted to reports of rising expenses.

title: Home Video
description: John Wayne Dust-Up

title: Upjohn Picks Stand-In for Chief, Gravely Ill
description: The Upjohn Company appointed Ley S. Smith acting chief executive yesterday after the chairman and chief executive, Dr. Theodore Cooper, became critically ill on Tuesday.

title: Diebold Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net loss and after a charge of $ 17,932,000 from an accounting adjustment.

title: William D. Miller, 74; Ran Metals Company
description: William Dawes Miller, a retired metals company executive and past president of the Metropolitan Club in Manhattan, died on Friday at his winter home in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 74 and also had homes in Manhattan and Southampton, L.I.

title: Glass That Flickers And Plays Tricks
description: IN "Glass Installations," which opens today at the American Craft Museum in Manhattan, six artists have designed works of glass that resemble a waterfall, tusks or fireflies darting around a cavern.

title: I.R.A.'s Surging As More People Invest in Funds
description: For Linda Wollman, the perils of darting through Park Avenue's rush-hour pile-ups on her Rollerblades were nothing compared with the risk of getting caught short of cash when she retires in, oh, about the year 2029. So with today's deadline for I.R.A. contributions looming, on Tuesday evening she rolled into the Fidelity Investments office at Park and 51st Street in Manhattan to drop off a check and an Individual Retirement Account form for her husband.

title: Rio Hotel & Casino Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a charge of $ 777,000 from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting principle: Adoption of Financial Accounting Standards Board Statement No. 109, ''Accounting for Income Taxes.''c-Included extraordinary income of $ 566,000, or 4 cents a share, from reduction of income taxes arising from carryforward of prior year's losses.

title: Drug Dealing Was Banned By Mob, U.S. Witness Says
description: Under cross-examination, Salvatore (Sammy Bull) Gravano conceded yesterday that any member of the Gambino crime family who dealt in drugs in the 1970's and 1980's would have been risking his life by breaking the family's rule against drug trafficking.

title:
CURRENTS;
See You Later, Radiator
description: ONE of spring's easiest upgrades is to freshen up your home with new slipcovers. While you're dressing up your frowzy chairs, why not also spruce up the unsightly radiators?

title: King World Productions reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: b-Included after-tax loss of $ 2,469,000 from deconsolidated operation in the quarter and $ 4,128,000 in the 6 months.

title: Do Beer and Olympics Mix?
description: It's a longstanding tradition, but to Paul Wood, president of the National Council on Alcoholism and Drug Abuse, it doesn't get any better with time. Accordingly, a day after Anheuser Busch became an official sponsor of the 1996 Olympic Games in Atlanta, he issued a formal protest against the $40 million deal, which will allow the brewery to use the five-ring symbol in its domestic advertising for three years.

title: In Caring for the Elderly, Students Prepare for Jobs
description: They seem an odd mix to be companionably spending afternoons together: frail residents in a geriatric nursing home, average age 86, and 100 students, 15 to 17, from the school next door.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt * Bear Stearns Companies, New York, is offering $200 million of 6 3/4 percent notes due in 2003 at 99.833 to yield 6.773 percent through Bear, Stearns & Co. The noncallable issue is rated A-2 by Moody's Investor Service and A by Standard & Poor's. * Canadian Pacific Ltd., Montreal, is offering $250 million of 6 7/8 percent notes due in 2003 at a price of 100 through Merrill Lynch. The noncallable notes are rated A-3 by Moody's and A- by S.& P.

title: Fernandez Makes His Pitch With Victory
description: If Sid Fernandez wants out of New York, he has a peculiar way of showing it. Perturbed that the Mets will not sign him to a contract extension, Fernandez disgustedly told his agent today, "They ought to just trade me," and then pitched a compact one-hit shutout for five innings.

title: Linear Technology Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 28
BOEING LAYS OFF ANOTHER 430 WORKERS AT KANSAS PLANT
description: The Boeing Company's plant in Wichita, Kan., laid off 430 employees this week and issued layoff notices to 394 others. The Wichita plant, which works on all of Boeing's commercial programs, has cut 860 jobs this year due to weakness in the airline industry. Boeing will cut the work force in Wichita by about 6,000 this year and about 1,000 in the first half of 1994, a spokesman said.

title: Where Artifacts Find Shelter After Many Storms
description: THEY live in an uncluttered six-room apartment in Manhattan with their two children, a pair of green shutters, a few well-worn porch columns and a sprinkling of weather vanes, cast-iron urns and hand-painted signs. All of which -- except the children -- are the pillars and posts of a decorating style that also encompasses salt-glazed crockery, wooden building blocks, primitive paintings and twig rockers.

title: Custody Wars Wound
description: To the Editor:

title: Worth Less?
description: The share price of Networth, a maker of computer equipment and a hot issue last year, has dropped sharply since December, and it plummeted yesterday. A third-quarter loss resulted from supply problems for a major product, an "intelligent hub" that lets networks of personal computers communicate.

title: Pop and Jazz in Review
description: Karen Akers Rainbow and Stars 30 Rockefeller Plaza Through May 8

title: First Fidelity to Buy Peoples Bank
description: Continuing an aggressive expansion campaign, the First Fidelity Bancorp, based in Lawrenceville, N.J., said yesterday that it would acquire Peoples Westchester Savings Bank, based in Hawthorne, N.Y., for $233 million in cash and stock.

title: Jets-Baxter Talks Stall
description: In one month, the Jets have signed four prominent unrestricted free agents, made a trade for a proven veteran quarterback and matched an offer from another team to keep a valuable defensive end.

title: 'Angels' Opening Postponed
description: The opening of "Angels in America: Millennium Approaches," the Pulitzer Prize-winning play by Tony Kushner, has been postponed to May 4 from April 29. The announcement by the show's producers, which came after the first preview at the Walter Kerr Theater on Tuesday night, stated that technical difficulties were the reason for the postponement.

title: Review/Music; If Concept Shadows Composition
description: Conceptual programming is a seductive possibility in today's concert life. Linking the pieces on a concert program can establish unexpected connections, spur new ways of listening and thinking, and even, some say, bring new audiences to music. But the more conceptual that conceptual programming gets and the more artful its attempts to connect and elaborate, the more the risk that the music itself will be eclipsed.

title: The Nanny Solution: Costly and Complex
description: IN-HOME child care has received a great deal of public attention recently as a result of President Clinton's troubles in finding a nominee for Attorney General. Yet, the in-home alternative is actually the least popular child-care choice of American families, because it is so much more expensive than family day care or day-care centers.

title: Nanny Held in the Murder Of a 10-Month-Old in Rye
description: A 25-year-old nanny who told the police that she loved a 10-month-old boy in her care "like her own" was charged today with murder in the boy's death last month from severe head injuries.

title: Minor League Playoffs Major Jolt for 3 Rangers
description: The Rangers faced rebellion from within yesterday, when Russian rookies Sergei Zubov and Aleksei Kovalev and Swede Peter Andersson responded unhappily to the organization's decision to send them to Binghamton to play for the team's minor league affiliate in the playoffs -- a decision that denies each of them the chance to represent their respective homelands in the world championships beginning next weekend in Munich.

title: A Jazz-Singing Legend Guides a New Generation
description: By the time Betty Carter started singing professionally, with Lionel Hampton's orchestra in 1948, she had made a decision to be different. Unlike most other singers of her generation, she didn't want to sound like Dinah Washington or Ella Fitzgerald or Sarah Vaughan.

title: CHRONICLE
description: As RUTH MESSINGER, Manhattan Borough President, saw it, if COLETTE AVITAL, Israel's new consul general in New York, was "the highest ranking Israeli woman diplomat, and if she was being sent to New York, one of the ways New York should receive her is with a luncheon of distinguished, diverse New York women."

title:
CURRENTS;
New World For Design: West Indies
description: THE consumption of new styles is as voracious in the furniture industry as it is in the fashion world. Every year, another country. What's new under the sun in 1993? The West Indies.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: METRO DIGEST PRATT & WHITNEY THREATENS TO CUT JOBS

title: Two Free Concerts At Mannes College
description: The Mannes College of Music Contemporary Festival is to present free concerts of works from around the world, on Monday and next Thursday at 8 P.M. in the school's concert hall, 150 West 85th Street, Manhattan. Monday's program, "African Influences," will feature music by African composers and by Western composers influenced by African styles and instruments. In addition to the music there will be a demonstration of West African instruments and instrumental techniques by the Ghanaian drummer Abraham K. Adzinyah.

title: Making Ashes, So That Something May Arise From Them
description: A roaring fire consumed a section of the New York Botanical Garden yesterday, burning knot weed and bramble, badly damaging stems of nut sedge and leaving clusters of perennial rye grass in ruins. The Fire Department said the blaze had been set, and officials pronounced themselves entirely pleased by the results.

title: COMPANY NEWS;
description: The Pacific Telesis Group, the regional Bell operating company based in San Francisco, said yesterday that it would take charges totaling $2 billion, or $4.91 a share, in the first quarter of 1993 to reflect changes in accounting for retiree health benefits and other post-employment benefits. As a result, Pactel will post an unspecified loss for 1993. In 1992, the company earned $1.14 billion, or $2.83 a share, on revenue of $9.94 billion.

title: Egypt's Trampling of Rights Fosters Extremism
description: To the Editor:

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: ALBERTA ENERGY CO., Calgary, Alta., plans to spend as much as $395 million to build an 820-mile oil pipeline between Edmonton and Cheyenne, Wyo. ECOGEN INC., Langhorne, Pa., a biological pesticides concern, received a patent for a gene that is useful in controlling pests like the Colorado potato beetle and the corn rootworm.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: P.& G., the Diaper Leader, Strikes Back
description: Besides coming as welcome news for parents everywhere, Procter & Gamble's decision Tuesday to reduce the price of their popular disposable diapers, Pampers and Luvs, again demonstrated how major consumer-products companies are absorbed with the challenge of low-priced private-label brands.

title: Settlement in Club Case
description: After three years, several million dollars in legal fees and some apocalyptic projections about the future of the game, an out-of-court settlement was reached today in the $100 million lawsuit by Karsten Manufacturing against the PGA Tour.

title: The Judge Sticks Up for the Homeless
description: Last November a New York City judge held four officials in contempt because homeless families were spending nights in welfare office waiting rooms. Now, with the problem continuing, the judge has ordered financial reimbursement for the families and threatens to hold the Mayor personally in contempt. That draws outrage from City Hall, yet the judge's frustration is understandable.

title: Reports Say Buttafuoco Is Indicted
description: The Nassau County District Attorney's office prepared to charge Joseph Buttafuoco today in the statutory rape of Amy Fisher, people familiar with the case said. Mr. Buttafuoco is to be charged with having sex with Miss Fisher when she was 16 years old.

title: Corrections
description: A brief report in the Health Watch column on the Health page in some editions yesterday about overdiagnosis of Lyme disease omitted a credit line. It was by The Associated Press.

title: Salomon Ratings Dropped
description: Concerned about volatile earnings of Salomon Inc., the Standard & Poor's Corporation has lowered the brokerage firm's long-term debt from A to A-, which is still investment grade.

title: Transactions
description: Baseball American League

title: Yields of Money Funds Off As Inflation Worries Ease
description: Yields offered by tax-exempt and taxable money market funds were down in the latest week, reflecting some easing of investor fears about inflation, according to the most recent survey by IBC's Money Fund Report.

title: Checkers Drive-In Restaurant (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Shares outstanding reflected secondary offering of 3 million shares in May 1992 and adjusted for 3-for-2 stock split in February 1992, and 2-for-1 stock split in September 1992.Corrected from yesterday's editions.

title: Population Control Doesn't Cure Poverty
description: To the Editor:

title: Sears Apparel Quits Ogilvy
description: The Sears Merchandise Group of Sears, Roebuck & Company dismissed Ogilvy & Mather yesterday from the apparel portion of its giant advertising account.

title: New York's Secretive Legislature
description: The leaders of New York's State Legislature are praising themselves for holding spending for the Legislature's own operations slightly below the whopping $168 million they gave themselves last year. But Assembly Speaker Saul Weprin and the Senate majority leader, Ralph Marino, deserve little credit until they tell taxpayers where the money actually goes.

title: TENSIONS RUN HIGH
description: A nationwide day of mourning for the slain black leader Chris Hani burst out of control today, as angry young blacks rioted through several cities in defiance of pleas for order.

title: Cavalier Homes Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to April 2
description: Year-ago share earnings and shares outstanding are adjusted for a 5-for-4 stock split paid November 1992.Cavalier Homes said that first quarter 1993 revenues included about $ 2.1 million in March sales from Homestead Homes Inc., which was acquired by Cavalier on Feb. 26, 1993.

title: With Nothing to Lose, Whalers Beat Islanders
description: Hockey is a sport where cliches come true. The Hartford Whalers proved that in duplicate tonight at the Civic Center. Fresh from tying the playoff-bound Islanders on Long Island Tuesday, they again played like men who had nothing to lose. And they didn't.

title: Corrections
description: An article in Business Day yesterday about The New York Times Company's first-quarter earnings misstated the latest reporting period for The Times's circulation. It was the six months ended March 31, 1993, not the quarter.

title: PARENT & CHILD
description: IF play is the work of childhood, then toys are the tools of that trade. But the tools are seldom the same for boys and girls. Despite the efforts of parents, teachers and other adults who, over the last 30 years, have tried to get children to play with toys that are less stereotyped by sex, it is almost a sure bet which children in a preschool will be brushing Barbie's hair and which will be crashing toy trucks.

title: Corrections
description: An article yesterday about the Pulitzer Prizes, and a picture caption in some copies, misidentified the category for which The Dallas Morning News won. It was spot news photography, not feature photography. Because of an editing error, the article also misstated the title of a series of reports in The Atlanta Journal-Constitution, honored for explanatory journalism. It was "When Bugs Fight Back."

title: Edna Amadon Toney, Writer and Actress, 79
description: Edna Amadon Toney, a writer, an actress and a producer, died on Tuesday at her home in Katonah, N.Y. She was 79.

title: A Million-Dollar Shot
description: An average fan found out last night how it feels to earn $1 million dollars for making a basket.

title: Democrats Retain House Seat in Mississippi
description: Democrats held on to the Second Congressional District in Tuesday's runoff election to fill the seat that Mike Espy left to become Secretary of Agriculture.

title: Standex International Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Los Angeles Juror's Illness Adds to a Complicated Task
description: A juror in the police beating case fell ill today, cutting short the fifth day of deliberations over what on its face appears to be a simple matter: Whether to mark "guilty" or "not guilty" in the blank spaces on four verdict forms -- one for each officer charged in the beating of Rodney G. King.

title:
CURRENTS;
Hail to the Chef: New Kitchen Wares
description: The thrill of the grill: the new Thermal Electric Grill from Thermos is ideal for use on apartment balconies where charcoal or gas is not a good idea, said its designer, Gregory Breiding. It is $229 at Gracious Home in Manhattan.

title: Simpson Industries (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a charge of $ 3 million from the cumulative effect of accounting changes.

title: Raytheon Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to April 4
Digital Loss Narrowed In Quarter
description: The Digital Equipment Corporation said yesterday that it was making progress on its return to profitability, primarily by slashing operating expenses. The company reported a fiscal third-quarter loss that was 10 times smaller than a year earlier on a slight rise in revenue.

title: Fed Move Nudges Treasuries Up
description: Treasury prices moved a little higher yesterday as the Federal Reserve helped support the market by buying Treasury securities.

title: Girl, 6, on Bicycle Ride Foils Abduction Attempt
description: A 6-year-old girl foiled an attempted kidnapping Tuesday night when she broke free from a man who had got out of a parked car and grabbed her by the shirt, the Nassau County police said today.

title: HOME IMPROVEMENT
description: HOUSEHOLD electrical repairs are often simple once you master the standard techniques for working with wire. Following are the basic accepted procedures for joining electrical wires and for fastening them to switches and wall outlets. In seeking more information, refer to books or pamphlets published in 1991 or later; these should comply with the National Electric Code, which was revised in 1990.

title: Justice Dept. to Investigate Mississippi Jail Deaths
description: Attorney General Janet Reno has ordered an investigation of 46 hanging deaths in Mississippi jails since 1987 to determine whether there is evidence of criminal wrongdoing by the authorities, Justice Department officials said today.

title: Wallace Stegner Is Dead at 84; Pulitzer Prize-Winning Author
description: Wallace Stegner, the novelist and short-story writer whose work celebrated the American West and won him the country's highest literary awards, died on Tuesday night at St. Vincent Hospital in Santa Fe, N.M. He was 84 and lived in Los Altos Hills, Calif.

title: Bridge
description: The state of Connecticut has not yet produced any world champions, but it has a group of very strong players who win frequently in the New York metropolitan area and are competitive at the national level. One is Richard De Martino of Riverside, Conn., who finished third in the Open Pairs three weeks ago at the Spring Nationals of the American Contract Bridge League. He was playing with Stephen Williams of Lawrenceville, N.J., and they were aided by the diagramed deal.

title: Sega Links With Cable Providers
description: Sega of America Inc., a video game leader with titles like, "Sonic the Hedgehog II" and "Streetfighter II: Champion Edition," said today that it would form a venture with the nation's two largest cable television companies to transmit Sega's games directly into homes via cable.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: The Economy

title: A.T.& T. Aims at Britain
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company will announce on Thursday plans to press for greater access to Britain's long-distance telephone market, sources said today. The move could lead to a bitter trade dispute with Britain's dominant telephone carrier, British Telecommunications P.L.C., which has asked the Federal Communications Commission for permission to provide end-to-end corporate service between the United States and Britain. That petition is still pending.

title: Ranger Garden Finale: Goals No, Boos Yes
description: Mike Gartner doesn't blame the Ranger fans. He'd boo too if he had to watch himself and his teammates play hockey these days. Last night, the Rangers tied their longest home losing streak, falling for the seventh straight time in a 2-0 defeat to the Washington Capitals.

title: Survey Finds Flaws in States' Water Inspections
description: A Government study released today found that most state inspection programs to insure the safety of public water systems were in a shambles.

title: White House Never Promised a Rose Garden
description: A warning to members of Congress who vote against President Clinton's big legislative proposals: Don't go looking for small favors from the White House.

title: Shares Drop As Goodrich Reports Loss
description: The B. F. Goodrich Company reported a $7.6 million first-quarter loss yesterday, a surprise that led to heavy morning selling of its stock. Its shares tumbled $3.125, to $44.875, in early trading on the New York Stock Exchange but later partly recovered to close at $46.875, off $1.125.

title: GFC Financial Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 1,338,000, or 6 cents a share, and a gain on sale of assets of $ 2,061,000.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 613,000, or 3 cents a share.

title: Help Belarus Become Nuclear-Free
description: Belarus has yet to reap the benefits of deciding to rid itself of the nuclear arms it inherited from the former Soviet Union. The U.S. has pledged aid to help Belarus disarm but has yet to deliver a cent. Washington has promised additional funds for food, medical and technical assistance but has delivered only a trickle.

title: A Simple 'Hai' Won't Do
description: When a TV announcer here reported Bill Clinton's comment to Boris Yeltsin that when the Japanese say yes they often mean no, he gave the news with an expression of mild disbelief.

title: Essay; The Grand Conclave
description: Dwight Eisenhower called us "sensation-seeking columnists and commentators"; Arthur Schlesinger Jr. labeled us "panjandrums of the Opinion Mafia."

title: New Time Life Editor
description: John L. Papanek, a former managing editor of Sports Illustrated, has been appointed editor in chief of Time Life Inc., a division of Time Warner Inc. headquartered in Alexandria, Va. Time Life markets books and music and has recently expanded into production of documentary and television programming. Mr. Papanek, who most recently was director of new media at Time Inc., succeeds Tom Flaherty, 64, who is retiring.

title: DMI Furniture Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 27
Takeover Bid By Teamsters To Run Local
description: The head of the national teamsters union moved yesterday to take over the New York City local that had been the power base of the ousted teamsters leader, Barry Feinstein. But in a struggle for control of the affiliate, Local 237 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, the local's executive board barred a national representative from entering their building yesterday and refused to vacate their offices.

title: Modern Player Bars Touchy Subjects
description: Last season when a Toronto player, during a game, called Steve Howe a "druggie," the pitcher threatened to put him "in extreme danger" the next time he batted. Last week, Yankee officials complained to the American League office about a post-game comment by an umpire that appeared to allude to Howe's drug-ridden past. When did Steve Howe, seven-time loser, become so untouchable that no one can utter a word about his past problems?

title: Fibreboard Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Satellite Finds Growing Threat to Ozone
description: Satellite measurements indicate an abundance of ozone-destroying chemicals remained in the atmosphere over the Northern Hemisphere much longer this winter than last, researchers said today. They said the finding could portend even greater ozone loss over highly populated parts of the world than in the past.

title: Review/Theater; Shaw on the Evils of Capitalism
description: Shaw's first play, "Widowers' Houses," is a dialectic on the evils of capitalism and the exploitation of the masses, the sort of thing Marx spent years working out in the Reading Room of the British Museum. Shaw's effort, which is being revived by the Pearl Theater Company on the play's centennial, is considerably shorter and a good deal more amusing than "Das Kapital."

title: Books of The Times; Evangelists of 2 Eras, In Tin Lizzies and on TV
description: Sister Aimee The Life of Aimee Semple McPherson By Daniel Mark Epstein Illustrated. 475 pages. Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. $27.95. Anatomy of a Fraud Inside the Finances of the P.T.L. Ministries By Gary L. Tidwell 357 pages. John Wiley & Sons. $24.95.

title: Keystone Consolidated Industries Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net loss and after a charge of $ 69,949,000 from the cumulative effect of adopting new accounting standards 106 and 109.

title: Roadway Services Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 27
description: b-Included a charge of $ 18,131,000 reflecting the adoption of new accounting rules regarding the recognition of the costs of providing health care benefits to certain retirees under age 65.Roadway Services said that results for the first quarter 1993 included revenue and earnings of Coles Express, which was purchased by the company in June 1992.

title: CHRONICLE
description: DANNY MEYER, the owner of the Union Square Cafe, did not have to be cajoled into lending a hand to help feed the hungry. Mr. Meyer is on the dinner committee for a benefit for the Food and Hunger Hotline next Thursday, at the Landmark on the Park, Central Park West and 76th Street. The party is being held to support the establishment of a restaurant on the Lower East Side that would offer the poor an alternative to soup kitchens.

title: Apartment-Hunting in New York With Michael and Pat York
description: THE buzz was spreading among the Hamptons-Park Avenue crowd like privileged information: Michael York, that versatile British actor who has shared the stage with nearly every show business legend from Laurence Olivier to Elizabeth Taylor, needed a place to stay in New York for a few months. And his wife, Pat York, a celebrity photographer who has also crisscrossed the globe, would be coming along to put the finishing touches on another book of photographs.

title: Alcan Aluminium Ltd.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Preferred-share dividends were $ 5 million in the latest first quarter, compared with $ 4 million in year-ago period.

title: Marriott Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 26
description: b-Included income of $ 30 million, or 28 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of the change in accounting for income taxes required by FASB No. 109.

title: Canandaigua Wine reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
AT THE OFFICE WITH: James Weikart; Steady at the Tiller In an Ocean of 1040's
description: JAMES WEIKART was in what he called his manic phase when Kathryn Watterson and her husband, Ron Sitts, walked into his Upper West Side office two Saturdays ago. Mr. Weikart, 52, the founding partner of Weikart Tax Associates, is not a person given to overstatement, and what he meant by manic was anyone's guess.

title: A Mansion of Dreams Awakes in Urban Peril
description: Michael Halberian's house towers above Bowery Bay from a rugged perch in Astoria, Queens, a 19th-century mansion of 27 rooms, with cast-iron porticoes and pillars that recall the villas nestled in the wrinkled green hills of Tuscany.

title: It's Over: The Devils End Penguins' Streak
description: First things first: The third- and fourth-place finishers in the Patrick Division will be determined Friday night when the Devils visit the Islanders in the regular-season finale.

title: Chile: Japan's Backdoor to the West
description: Reaching across thousands of miles of the Pacific, Japan and Chile have been quietly forming close economic and political ties in the last two years, ties that potentially challenge the long-standing dominance of the American business presence here.

title: Stormy Caterpillar Meeting
description: Caterpillar Inc. and angry union members sparred orally today as company officers tried to convince shareholders that long-term prospects were bright despite 1992 losses.

title: Children's Needs
description: To the Home Section:

title: Ewing's Spree Sparks Knicks
description: It was another nail-biting game that called upon their nerve and determination. Once again, the Knicks passed the test.

title:
CURRENTS;
A Poor Man's Baccarat
description: DESIGNING for Baccarat, the crystal company, taught Miguel Calvo, 24, to love transparent objects. It also taught him that he wasn't earning enough to buy his own designs. So he traded Paris for New York and crystal for vinyl upholstery fabric.

title: Economic Scene; The Labor Secretary's Spin On Jobs Data Lifts Eyebrows
description: At a time when the economic outlook is confused and the President's economic stimulus package faces opposition, it should come as no surprise that the Clinton Administration is eager to put its own spin on politically charged economic statistics.

title: Gillette Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After a charge of $ 138,600,000 from an accounting adjustment.

title: Cullen/Frost Bankers (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included an $ 8.4 million gain from an accounting change and a $ 1.9 million charge related to a retirement incentive program.Share amounts for the latest and year-earlier results have been adjusted for a 10 percent stock dividend.

title: Rollins Environmental Services Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Review/Theater; 2 One-Woman Plays, Each Starring the Author
description: Marga Gomez was a child of the city, emotionally uprooted, whose parents were flamboyantly concerned with the world of Latin American show business. In contrast, Charlayne Woodard had a secure, middle-class background in upstate New York, and her parents stressed traditional family values. Each woman emerged with her individuality intact and with her imagination nurtured into creativity.

title: Dr. Harrison Echols, 59, Biologist Who Led Study of Viral Infections
description: Dr. Harrison Echols, a biologist whose findings advanced the understanding of viral infections and normal cell functions, died on Sunday at his home in Berkeley, Calif. He was 59.

title: At the Bar; A lawyer says his letter to a rival was meant to be funny, but the rival says she isn't laughing.
description: David Cwik tried to get a laugh out of his opposing counsel. Instead, he said something stupid and, as he puts it, he "saw a mushroom cloud erupt."

title: Andover Bancorp (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included gain of $ 107,000 from sales of securities and loans.c-Included gain of $ 2.1 million from sales of securities and loans and gain of $ 484,000 from receipt of Savings Bank Life Insurance Co. of Massachusetts stock.

title: Corrections
description: An article on April 3 about appointments to the Department of Justice misstated the age of Webster L. Hubbell, who was named Associate Attorney General. He is 45.

title: Chiefs and Montana Closer
description: The Kansas City Chiefs moved closer to a financial accord with Joe Montana yesterday, remaining the front-runner over Phoenix to acquire the 36-year-old quarterback through a trade with San Francisco.

title: Critic's Choice/Film; Revival of a Revival House
description: Regulars at the old Regency, once a pre-eminent revival house on the Upper West Side, will be happy to hear that the Gramercy Theater at 127 East 23d Street, Manhattan, begins its new life as a revival house tomorrow. It will be programmed by Frank Rowley, who was once the Regency's dedicated programmer and then moved to the Biograph, which closed in 1991. The Gramercy will now be run by Mr. Rowley as a nonprofit theater, with help from the Samuel Goldwyn Company and EVAC Inc., a New York nonprofit community improvement organization. The theater will charge $6.50 for each double feature.

title: Survey Stirs Debate on Number of Gay Men in U.S.
description: A survey's finding that only 1 percent of men identify themselves as homosexual has renewed intense debate over the number of gay people in America.

title: U.S. Decides It Won't Prosecute Case of Altered Iraq Export Papers
description: After a nearly two-year investigation, the Justice Department has decided not to prosecute anyone in connection with a Bush Administration document that was doctored to conceal the military uses of some exports to Iraq, a Congressman whose committee received the falsified list said today.

title: Dinkins Reports Higher Income
description: While New York City's economy may still be in the doldrums, Mayor David N. Dinkins did much better financially in 1992 than in the year before, according to income-tax returns he released yesterday.

title: Enron Oil & Gas Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Meridian Bancorp (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included income of $ 7,221,000, or 15 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.Per share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

title: Animals and Fungi: Evolutionary Tie?
description: They may seem awfully vegetative in their habits, and the university researchers who study them may often be counted as members of the botany department, but fungi are turning out to be far more closely related to animals than to plants, scientists say.

title: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a $ 20,000,000 extraordinary loss on early retirement of debt and $ 20,000,000 gain on accounting change.

title: Former State Trooper Explains Ways He Fabricated Evidence
description: Shedding new light on the first evidence-tampering scandal in New York State Police history, a former state police investigator today admitted fabricating evidence in 21 criminal cases.

title: Last Chance
description: Here is a sampling of shows and art exhibitions in the New York metropolitan region that close soon: Closing This Weekend

title: Altera Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Fifth Third Bancorp (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
FMC Gold Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Restaurants
description: Sprawling, theatrical and loud, Sfuzzi is to an Italian trattoria what the Hard Rock Cafe is to a hamburger joint. This branch of a Dallas-based chain seems decidedly formulaic and calculated. So much so that one suspects that a bevy of Texas executives has already determined how much food and wine you will order, the quantity of bread you will consume, approximate seating time, even napkin use.

title: Discus Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 27
NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-11 Seeking to lift the political fortunes of Boris Yeltsin, the leading industrialized nations committed themselves to $28 billion in aid for Russia this year, but much of it was contingent on austerity steps that Moscow may find difficult to adopt. A1 Countries pledging aid to Russia also stand to benefit. A10

title: Yes, Mr. McEnroe. No, Mr. McEnroe.
description: JOHN McENROE says he is thinking about coaching ANDRE AGASSI now that he has all but announced his retirement from professional tennis.

title: The Shot Heard Round Chicago
description: No National Basketball Association agents came calling for DON CALHOUN yesterday. Everyone else did.

title: On the Ballot and Off the Books
description: Like barriers in a swiftly moving river, campaign spending laws do not block the flow of big money, say New Jersey political analysts; they merely divert it into side currents or momentarily drive it beneath the surface.

title: Worthy Versions Of 'The Ring': A Critical Selection; Georg Solti
description: The Decca/London "Ring" (414 100-2; 15 CD's), conducted by Georg Solti and produced by John Culshaw, was the first complete version of the cycle recorded in a studio; for many, it has remained pre-eminent. What distinguishes this "Ring," made between 1958 and 1965, from some recent competitors is the Vienna Philharmonic's sonic splendor, combined with masterly singing in nearly all the major roles.

title: We Need to Recognize Sex-Linked Diseases
description: To the Editor:

title: Pressed, U.S. Issues Report on Bosnia Havens
description: Bowing to Congressional pressure, the State Department today made public a report by Clinton Administration experts recommending the creation of militarily protected "safe havens" for the Bosnian Muslims.

title: Briggs & Stratton Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
American Health Properties Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included gain of $ 19.7 million on the sale of the company's acute care hospital in Aurora, Colo. Adjusted for this gain, net income for the quarter was 65 cents a share.

title: Dauphin Deposit (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Agency Rent-A-Car (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After a net special charge of $ 2,274,000 in connection with ceasing operations in certain markets in both the quarter and year.

title: Don Clay, 46, Teacher And Interior Designer
description: Don Clay, an interior designer in Manhattan, died on Monday at the Cabrini Hospice in Manhattan. He was 46.

title: Insurance Hurdles to Health-Care Reform
description: Workers' compensation and automobile insurance, two largely private insurance systems that pay more than $40 billion in health- care bills each year, are presenting the President's Task Force on National Health Care Reform with a devilish dilemma.

title: ENRON CORP. (N)
description: The Enron Corporation, the diversified natural-gas company, said rising prices and demand for gas bolstered its first-quarter profits.

title: TV Weekend; World Ends Not With a Bang, but a Heat Wave
description: Just in time for International Earth Week, CBS is broadcasting "The Fire Next Time" on Sunday and Tuesday, both nights at 9. The four-hour movie follows the odyssey of a family trying to escape the accelerating horrors of global warming. The time is given as "sometime soon," about 25 years from now.

title: Debate Rises on Hanoi P.O.W. Report
description: A United States envoy left today on a mission to Vietnam, but President Clinton instructed him that new questions about American prisoners of war must be resolved before there can be any thaw in relations with Hanoi.

title: First Midwest Bancorp (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Burlington Northern reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After a net charge of $ 21,000,000, which included charge of $ 11 million for change in accounting for revenue recognition, and charge of $ 10 million for change in accounting for postretirement benefits.

title: Nellcor Inc. (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to April 4
Of Learning Amid Leisure: Molto Bello
description: L'ALBERGO di Monte Mohonk e bello e romantico -- molto bello, molto romantico.

title: Seagram Beverage Group Hires Top Executive From RJR
description: With a new leadership just getting started and a complicated stock offering in the works, RJR Nabisco lost one of its prized executives yesterday. Ellen R. Marram left as president of the Nabisco Biscuit Company, the cookie and cracker division of the Nabisco Foods Group, to become president of the Seagram Beverage Group.

title: NORTHWEST AGREES TO PAY $5 MILLION FOR LONDON ROUTE
description: Northwest Airlines said yesterday that it planned to buy USAir's Baltimore-to-London route for $5 million and move the route's terminus to Detroit by mid-June. The airline already has direct flights to London's Gatwick airport from Minneapolis/St. Paul and Boston. "Detroit is our largest domestic hub, providing a strong flow both of local origin and connecting passengers for domestic flights," said John Dasburg, Northwest's chief executive.

title: Cooker Restaurant Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to April 4
First Amarillo Bancorp (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $ 6,000,000, or 91 cents a share, from cumulative effect of an accounting change in the latest quarter and an extraordinary tax credit of $ 1,006,626, or 20 cents a share, in year-ago period.Per share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

title: Loblolly Parades a Pair of Entries
description: Just two weeks from show time, final auditions for the Kentucky Derby will be held tomorrow when 12 colts compete in the $500,000 Wood Memorial at Aqueduct and 11 run in the $500,000 Arkansas Derby at Oaklawn Park.

title: Chief of Party Steps Down In New York
description: John A. Marino, Gov. Mario M. Cuomo's hand-picked chairman of the State Democratic Committee, announced today that he was resigning after four years to take a job with a Manhattan investment firm.

title: A Skewed Census Endures
description: Every national census has failed to count millions of Americans, and for at least five decades the undercounted have disproportionately been urban minorities. So New York, Los Angeles and other victims of the undercount started urging the Census Bureau years ago to adjust the numbers using accepted statistical techniques.

title: Central & South West reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
J. P. Morgan Says Profit Up 64% in First Quarter
description: J. P. Morgan & Company said yesterday that good results in most of its major businesses produced a first-quarter profit of $432 million before accounting changes, up about 64 percent from $264 million a year earlier.

title: German Split on Peacekeeping Role
description: Increasingly fierce Serbian attacks in Bosnia and Herzegovina over the last month, and a court ruling allowing a limited German role in trying to stop them, have intensified the political debate about whether a reunited Germany can play a stronger military role in peacekeeping operations.

title: First Bank System reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a gain of $ 151,900,000, or $ 1.79 a share, from an accounting adjustment.

title: NBD Bancorp Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included income of $ 3,950,000, or 3 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting principle, reflecting SFAS No. 106 and No. 109.c-Included a charge of $ 37,885,000 from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting principle, reflecting SFAS No. 106 and No. 109.

title: First Control Crime, Then Worry About Poverty
description: Why the producers of this vigorous hourlong documentary on crime thought they needed two journalists to front their program is perplexing, especially since Fred Barnes and Morton Kondracke are in total agreement on all points; when they are on camera together they seem to be completing each other's paragraphs. Already colleagues, both at The New Republic and on "The McLaughlin Group," maybe they have ambitions to be the Weber and Fields of punditry.

title: Balkan Peace Depends on Talking to Serbs Also; Don't Spread the War
description: To the Editor:

title: Bosnia Yielding Town to Serbs, U.N. Aides Say
description: United Nations officials said tonight that Bosnian defenders were negotiating a surrender to Serbian forces of the besieged Muslim enclave at Srebrenica that would guarantee the evacuation of 60,000 civilians and the beleaguered garrison.

title: Bank of New Hampshire reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included $ 1.1 million from early adoption of SFAS 109, accounting for income taxes.

title: Guard Is Dead At Ohio Prison, Putting Toll at 8
description: In a day of rapid swings in mood and tone at the Southern Ohio Correctional Facility here, the body of a dead guard was turned over to prison officials today and another hostage was released unharmed after an inmate was allowed to speak on live radio.

title: Flexsteel Industries (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-lossc-Included a net restructuring charge of $ 1,675,000 in both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Review/Film; Wife Seeks To Right Wrong Done To Husband
description: "The Story of Qiu Ju" was shown as part of the 1992 New York Film Festival. Following are excerpts from Janet Maslin's review, which appeared in The New York Times on Oct. 2, 1992. The film, in Mandarin with English subtitles, opens today at the Lincoln Plaza Cinema, Broadway at 63d Street, with a rating of PG (Parental guidance suggested).

title: Worthy Versions Of 'The Ring'
description: WAGNER'S "Ring des Nibelungen," a cycle of four large-scale operas intended to be performed on consecutive evenings, has achieved wide circulation on the stage as well as on disk and tape in recent decades, but the sheer scope of the undertaking insures that each new outing will remain an event.

title: Fingerhut Cos.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 26
Tax-Protest Leader to Oppose Florio
description: John Budzash, the mail carrier who organized the huge statewide tax protest that seemed to put the political future of Gov. Jim Florio in serious jeopardy, filed today as a candidate to oppose the Governor in the June 8 primary.

title: After National Search, Yale Picks Its Graduate Dean to Be President
description: After a nationwide search for a president to lead it into the 21st century, Yale University turned to its own campus today and selected Richard C. Levin, a 46-year-old economist who has spent nearly half his life at the university, most recently as dean of its Graduate School of Arts and Sciences.

title: Crown Cork & Seal reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After a net charge of $ 65,700,000, which reflects cumulative effect of changes in accounting for income taxes (a gain of $ 23.5 million, or 28 cents a share) and postretirement benefits other than pensions (a loss of $ 89.2 million).c-Net income

title: Fritz Steinhardt; Professor, 71
description: Prof. Fritz Steinhardt, who taught mathematics at City College for 39 years, died on Wednesday at his home on Manhattan's Upper West Side. He was 71.

title: Golden West Financial reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Sounds Around Town
description: Betty Carter and Friends

title: Worthy Versions Of 'The Ring': A Critical Selection; Clemens Krauss
description: The idea of a "best" as applied to so sprawling and diverse an assortment of music as Wagner's "Ring" may seem illusory, so I will proceed to proclaim the 1953 Bayreuth Festival "Ring" conducted by Clemens Krauss (Foyer 2011; 15 CD's) the best on records.

title: Store Trying to Balance Country and Countrified
description: SPRING has brought a truce between the new owners of the tiny, Civil War-era general store and the old potbellied coal stove that has heated it for decades. Sally and Angelo Vilardi no longer fret each day about starting and stoking the coal fire and mastering the knack of banking it so it glows and warms the store all night and into the next morning.

title: Immigrant Enrollment Rises In New York City Schools
description: Accelerating a trend of recent years, 65,322 immigrant children entered New York City's public schools in the last year, creating new pressures to increase the number of classrooms, expand bilingual education programs and provide other services for foreign-born students.

title: Blue Jays Jettison Dayley
description: Left-handed relief pitcher KEN DAYLEY was released by the Toronto Blue Jays yesterday.

title: BASEBALL: At Elizabeth High School; Good and Bad Innings Come With Territory
description: Listen to the Professor of Pitching: "The world is full of throwers. Coaching is about getting the throwers into a pitching mentality. I tell the kids that pitching is only three things, in and out, up and down, fast and slow. You mix that up to disrupt the batter, tilt the strike zone, and you do that all the time, even when you're warming up or tossing the ball around. You are always pitching, thinking, loosening your brain along with your arm."

title: Dime Moves To Build Up Capital Level
description: The Dime Savings Bank of New York announced two deals yesterday that could help it emerge from its troubles with bad real estate loans and low levels of capital.

title: Around the Majors: Surgery for Ryan
description: Strikeout king NOLAN RYAN's farewell tour was put on hold yesterday when he underwent surgery for torn knee cartilage that will sideline him for three to six weeks. The arthroscopic procedure on the right knee lasted about 40 minutes, said Dr. JOHN CONWAY, orthopedic consultant for the Texas Rangers.

title: Neworld Bancorp (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included income of $ 6,033,000, or $ 1.43 a share, from the cumulative effect of change in accounting principle.c-Included an extraordinary gain of $ 1,885,000, or 46 cents a share, from reorganization of Savings Bank Life Insurance.

title: Boatmen's Bancshares (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: Year-ago net income included the effect of adoption of new accounting rules for income taxes. The change resulted in a reduction of the company's income tax expense of $ 3.6 million, which it said added 7 cents a share to per-share net income.

title: Gotti's Lawyer Confronts Mafia Turncoat in Court
description: Bristling with his trademark anger, Bruce Cutler confronted Salvatore Gravano in court yesterday, portraying him as an unreliable witness who betrayed and killed people who had trusted him.

title: NEW MOVES IN U.N. TO RESTRAIN SERBS
description: The Security Council is expected to hold an emergency session on Friday to consider imposing tough new sanctions on Yugoslavia immediately if the besieged Bosnian town of Srebrenica falls to Serbian forces.

title: A 4-0 Yankee Lead Is Going . . . Going . . . Gone
description: When Brian McRae forced the Yankees to leave the bases loaded with a twisting, falling, groping, lunging catch in deep center field to end the eighth inning, the loud standing ovation he received at Yankee Stadium seemed little more than a spectacular footnote to another successful game for Jimmy Key.

title: Yeltsin Attacking Old Foes And Some New Ones, Too
description: Campaigning at full tilt for the national referendum now 10 days away, President Boris N. Yeltsin lashed out today at his Vice President, the legislature and the chairmen of the Central Bank and the Constitutional Court.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Johnson Controls reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
Art in Review
description: Jay DeFeo Nicole Klagsbrun 51 Greene Street SoHo Through tomorrow

title: Review/Music; Night of the Solo Bassoon
description: If oboists and clarinetists can play solo recitals, why not bassoonists? Jean-Francois Duquesnoy, a French bassoonist in his early 20's, demonstrated that his instrument is capable of warmth and virtuosity in a short but telling program on Tuesday evening at Weill Recital Hall.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Tuesday about a state assessment of the Newark school system misstated the view of D. Kim Thompson Gaddy, a member of the city's school board. She said she believed that unless new leadership joined the board after the April 20 election, the state would seek to take control of the schools, not necessarily that it should.

title: Review/Film; Mrs. Rochester No. 1, Long Before 'Jane Eyre'
description: John Duigan's "Wide Sargasso Sea," adapted from the Jean Rhys novel, is something you don't often see in movies these days: a seriously exotic Gothic romance that is as lean and pared down as, say, the 1944 film adaptation of Charlotte Bronte's "Jane Eyre" is big and thunderously emotional.

title: Review/Film; He's His Sister's Keeper, and What a Job That Is
description: "Benny and Joon" is a dangerously fanciful story of cute eccentrics, characters whose quirks are the very essence of their appeal. Some of us experience a form of red alert at the very notion of adorable oddballs on screen, but "Benny and Joon" turns out to be remarkably benign in that regard.

title: Scripps Howard Broadcasting (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included copyright adjustment which increased operating income $ 4.3 million and net income by $ 2.7 million, or 26 cents a share.

title: Clintons' Income for '92 Is Put at $290,000
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton made more than $250,000 last year, helping the Clintons to earn $290,000, their highest income ever, according to tax data made public today by the White House.

title: Boy Hurt in School Stabbing
description: A New Bedford teen-ager was stabbed by a student outside a school today, four days after a high school student was stabbed to death in class six miles away, in Dartmouth. New Bedford police said Eric Wordell, 15, was stabbed in the back and shoulder outside Normandin Junior High School by a 14-year-old Normandin student. Mr. Wordell, who attends a school across town, was treated at a hospital and released. The Normandin student, whose name is being withheld because of his age, was arrested shortly after the incident.

title: Mexico Sees Progress On Trade Pact Problems
description: Mexican officials said today that their differences had narrowed with the United States over how to deal with environmental and labor problems under a North American Free Trade Agreement.

title: American International Petroleum Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 2,157,690, which included a charge of $ 913,000 on the sale of the company's domestic oil and gas operations and a reserve of $ 1.24 million against a note receivable issued by the lessee at the Lake Charles refinery..

title: Bank South Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included $ 3.8 million in securities gains and $ 2.1 million in retirement and restructuring programs.c-Included $ 6.1 million in securities gains.

title: Corrections
description: An article in Business Day on Tuesday about the new president at Sears, Roebuck & Company's automotive group referred incorrectly to the resolution of 1992 accusations that the group had recommended unnecessary repairs. Sears reached a settlement with officials in California, conceding instances of unnecessary repairs, but not admitting widespread wrongdoing.

title: CCB Financial (NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After a net charge of $ 1,371,000 from an accounting adjustment.Per-share amounts reflected restatement for 3-for-2 stock split effected in form of 50 percent stock dividend paid Oct. 1, 1992.The company said cumulative changes in accounting principles reflected the adoption of FASB 106, accounting for post-retirement benefits, which resulted in after-tax charge of $ 2,271,000, and adoption of FASB 109, accounting for income taxes, which resulted in a gain of $ 900,000.

title: KLA Instruments Corp.(NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-After gain on discontinued PCB business of $ 2,800,000, or 15 cents a share, in both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Both Sides Talk of Pact On Jobs Bill
description: Suspending their public quarrel over President Clinton's $19.5 billion plan to stimulate the economy, Mr. Clinton declared today that he was willing to scale back his proposal, and Senate Republicans signaled they were ready to discuss an agreement.

title: MBNA Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: MBNA said that the per share and shares outstanding for 1992 reflected a 2-for-1 stock split on Feb. 12, 1993.

title: USAIR TO ISSUE 10 MILLION SHARES OF STOCK
description: USAir Group plans to sell 10 million shares of common stock in an offering that would raise roughly $220 million at the current stock price. Industry observers said the airline company was trying to take advantage of the strong performance of its stock to pay down high-interest debt.

title: Abroad at Home; 'Where Reason Is Free'
description: We celebrate Thomas Jefferson's 250th birthday this week with the respect due a monument of our history: the author of the Declaration of Independence, a President who with his friends Madison and Monroe made a 24-year Virginia dynasty in the White House.

title: Theater Preserved
description: To the Editor:

title: Donors Also See Gain in Aid Package
description: While there were arguments here today over how much of the $28 billion in aid pledged by the wealthy industrial nations will reach Russia quickly, there were fewer doubts about another group likely to benefit: foreign businesses eager to finance risky operations in Russia.

title: Is This Just a Brief Moment in Time for Nets?
description: Are the Nets in the process of building a championship contender or collapsing into another state of suburban decay? Stephen Hawking would have trouble figuring out the evolution of their universe.

title: Delta Will Take Write-Off of $82.5 Million
description: Delta Air Lines Inc. said yesterday it would take an $82.5 million write-off in the most recent quarter to cover severance payments for 600 pilots and retire 21 jets.

title: CHRONICLE
description: It is 75 years since Fordham University Law School admitted women -- eight of them -- to the class of 1918, and on Monday, a yearlong celebration of that milestone will begin with a reception. A portrait of FRANCES BERKO, class of '44, who is the New York State Advocate for the Disabled (she has cerebral palsy), will be unveiled in the Moot Court Room of the law school, on the Lincoln Center campus.

title: Schwab Shares Fall Despite Report of 19.2% Jump in Profit
description: Charles Schwab & Company reported yesterday that its first-quarter earnings jumped 19.2 percent, but that was not enough to prevent a sharp decline in its stock price after a Wall Street analyst reduced his ratings on Schwab and other securities firms, saying their stock prices were too high.

title: Parking Rules
description: Because of Orthodox Good Friday, alternate-side parking rules are suspended in New York City today.

title: Scripps (E.W.) Co. (N) reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included gain of $ 12.1 million, or 16 cents a share, on the sale of Pharos Books and World Almanac Education; $ 2.3 million, or 3 cents a share, on a copyright accrual change, and $ 1.6 million for a fee associated with the change in ownership of the Ogden Standard-Examiner.c-Net loss and included a charge of $ 22,413,000 from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Federal Paper Board Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 27
description: b-Included a gain of $ 9,000,000, or 22 cents a share, from the adoption of FAS 109.

title: Review/Art; Hated the Nazis, Loved the Soviets, Created Images to Mock and Admire
description: The John Heartfield exhibition opening today at the Museum of Modern Art, the first substantial show in an American museum to be devoted to Heartfield, is overdue in paying tribute to one of the more inventive, and underappreciated, artists of the century.

title: Explaining An Ad Switch
description: Herman's World of Sporting Goods and Bozell Inc. have shed some light on the surprising decision earlier this week by the sporting goods chain to award its estimated $25 million to $30 million account to Bozell. Bozell's selection was unexpected because the agency was a last-minute entrant in the lengthy review, which had been previously narrowed to Backer Spielvogel Bates Inc. in New York and Young & Rubicam New York.

title: Potlatch Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included charge of $ 75,494,000 for change in accounting for postretirement benefits other than pensions, net of taxes, and a credit of $ 43,790,000 for a change in accounting for income taxes.c-Net income

title: The Ghost Called Tibet
description: Like a family ghost that intermittently makes an awkward appearance, the matter of Tibet is coming up again. In late April His Holiness the Dalai Lama, a Nobel Peace Prize laureate and spiritual leader of an ill-used country, is due to meet President Clinton. This does not mean that the State Department has retreated from its legalistic view that Tibet is part of China. But it does offer Mr. Clinton a chance to express American sentiments on the human cost of that cold determination.

title: Hearing-Aid Phone Rules Are Delayed
description: Bowing to a wave of protest from businesses and trade associations, the Federal Communications Commission yesterday suspended enforcement of regulations that would have required establishments with 20 or more employees to make all telephones hearing-aid compatible by May 1.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt * Florida Power and Light Co., Miami, a subsidiary of the FPL Group, is offering $225 million of 7.30 percent first-mortgage bonds due in 2016 at 98 to yield 7.483 percent through Lehman Brothers. Callable in five years, the bonds are rated A-2 by Moody's Investor Service and A by Standard & Poor's.

title: Police Officer Arrested
description: A police officer was arrested yesterday on five counts of possession of cocaine, officials said. Officer Sergei Denecko, 31, who was assigned to the 52d Precinct in the Bronx, was accused of buying cocaine at least 240 times in 1990 and 1991, paying at least $44,000. The arrest resulted from a joint Federal-city investigation into narcotics trafficking that has led to the apprehension of 47 people. Investigators captured records detailing the officer's purchases when they arrested his supplier in October 1991, according to the U.S. Attorney's office in Manhattan. Officer Denecko was suspended without pay pending the outcome of the investigation.

title: FMC Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Net loss and after an extraordinary charge of $ 9,200,000 and a charge of $ 183,700,000 which reflects the cumulative effect of change in accounting for postretirement benefits.Year-ago income from continuing operations of $ 54,500,000, or $ 1.49 share, is restated to reflect a net of tax increase in postretirement expense of $ 200,000.

Market Place; Southland's stock is rising on rumors of a buyout from Japan.
description: THE SOUTHLAND CORPORATION, the owner and franchiser of 7-Eleven convenience stores, saw its sales shrink and its losses rise last year. But its stock price is suddenly spurting higher. It has risen 51 percent this month, including an increase of 34 percent so far this week, and closed yesterday at $5.34 a share, up 34 cents.

title: Sounds Around Town
description: 2 Leader-Driven Bands

title: Worthy Versions Of 'The Ring': A Critical Selection; James Levine
description: James Levine's ubiquitous "Ring" has been thoroughly dissected in recent seasons, both as the current Metropolitan Opera production and in its various appearances on television, home video (Deutsche Grammophon 072 522; 11 laser disks or seven VHS cassettes) and CD (Deutsche Grammophon 427 607-2, 423 389-2, 429 407-2, 429 385-2; 15 CD's). Briefly, Otto Schenk's production adheres closely to Wagner's stage directions and scenic descriptions, keeping the story in a traditionally conceived world of gods and mortals of various stripes. Gunther Schneider-Siemssen's sets and projections strive to combine naturalism and mythical grandeur. And the company did not stint on either detail (you could probably make a sword after watching this "Siegfried") or spectacle (the ending of "Gotterdammerung" is appropriately cataclysmic).

title: PNC Bank Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to March 31
description: b-Included a charge of 19,393,000 related to an accounting change.c-Included a charge of $ 102,501,000 related to an accounting change.

title: Robertson Trying Again To Put Prayer in Schools
description: At Blue Ridge High School in Farmer City, Ill., 63 of the 66 members of the Class of 1993 recently voted to say prayers during their graduation ceremony next month.

description: b-Included a gain of $ 1,106,000, or 8 cents a share, from cumulative effect of change in accounting for adoption of FASB No. 109.The company said all share results reflect the 3-for-2 stock split effective April 22, 1992.
